messages.subject: Mumei Hizen blades
messages.msgSnippet: Dear All, I am seeking opinion and others experience. I have had many long and very enjoyable conversations with Roger Robertshaw about a katana blade I
messages.messageBody:
Dear All,
I am seeking opinion and others experience. I have had many long and very enjoyable conversations with Roger Robertshaw about a katana blade I currently own. It appears to be an early Tadayoshi blade. This is confirmed by a sayagaki and a presentation inscription dated 1922.
I am reasonably confident that it is indeed early Hizen work. However Roger is rightly sceptical about the existence of unsigned Hizen work being attributed to the mainline school. With a nagasa of 65.2cm. there is just the possibility that it is O-suriage and has lost the original signature. Alternatively it could be that it was never signed. I intend to submit the blade at the forthcoming NTHK shinsa in London. Does anyone know of unsigned Tadayoshi blades that have received papers?
any opinions and information much appreciated
thanks
Paul
